item.title: How would you add a point system to a server
item.dc:creator: @HixkPK HixkPK
item.description:
@HixkPK wrote:

Here’s the theory I used to make mine:

Upon killing a mob, the server gets the mobs combat level, multiplies it by .55, multiplies that by 1.5, and doubles it’s precision, saves it under an int that’s already defined and loaded upon login, saved upon logout, which makes the coding two times as easy as it would to make a completely new int for no reason whatsoever. As for code, from the information I’ve given you it shouldn’t be hard for you to code this in an RSCD base.

Read full topic

@Vrunk wrote:

[quote=“DonnyB4e56, post:10, topic:211446”] if CharacterPoints >= 20; blah blah blah else CharacterPoints <= 20; println "You don't have enough points"; blah blah blah

would it be something like that? I don’t know im not very far in my java book about chapter .5? Hopefully this helped.[/quote]

You’ve got a long ways to go, my friend…

Read full topic
item.source: How would you add a point system to a server

item.title: How would you add a point system to a server
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

It’s just an int that holds your points, gets loaded upon logged in, and saved upon disconnection. Then the NPC basicly exactly what u said, like

int points = player.getPoints(); // You’d have to make these methods too.
if (points >= 20) {
points = points - 20; // remove points.
player.addExp(2, 20000); // adding 20k exp for 20 points onto Str
player.addExp(3, 20000 / 3); // add 1/3 exp to HP
player.getActionSender().sendStats(); // Updates the client.
return;
} else {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Not enough points”);
return;
}

Something like that, dont try c/p that either cause it will not work. But you get the point

You will need to make a new row in the db as well and some methods to get/set points, and some client modifications, and a formula for how many points per exp/money

Read full topic
item.source: How would you add a point system to a server

item.title: How would you add a point system to a server
item.dc:creator: @kingigor55 kingigor55
item.description:
@kingigor55 wrote:

[quote=“DonnyB4e56, post:10, topic:211446”]Im just a beginner in java, but you would have to code another mysql space for the number of points on a certian account/character. This would require codeing a lot in the source files to. Im not sure if i’ll get laughed at for this but i think it would be something like this:

if CharacterPoints >= 20;
blah blah blah
else CharacterPoints <= 20;
println "You don't have enough points";
blah blah blah

would it be something like that? I don’t know im not very far in my java book about chapter .5? Hopefully this helped.[/quote]

It really doesn’t take too much code to get it working, and what you’re just doing is 1) incorrect and 2)it’s just a simple block of code that checks whether the # of character points exceeds a certain value…it doesn’t do anything to actually implement it initially.

Read full topic
